moves.1. e4: thought i would give annotating a try.
moves.1... c5: c pawn opening for black should lead to quick counterattack
moves.2. Nf3 d6 3. Bc4 e6: looks like the beginning of the Ruy vs. the sicillian def.
moves.4. d4: a little gambit.  white is looking to control the middle and begin king side attack while thwarting blacks queen side attack.
moves.4... cxd4 5. Nxd4: current position is in whites favor. by both development and space controled.
moves.5... Nf6 6. Nc3 a6: a passive move which does little for blacks development. this delay in developing his pieces will contribute greatly to blacks eventual demise.
moves.7. Be3: white continues to develope his troops for combat.  focusing on king side attack and contrl of the center.   take note on bishops position.
moves.7... b5: this move was anticipated when a6 was made. however; did not concern me
moves.8. Bb3: simple retreat still owning the diagonal
moves.8... Bb7: an attack on the e4 pawn, black seems to want to take some claim to the middle.   Is it too late?
moves.9. f3: f3 comes to e4 defence.  also limits the queen from  jumping into action right away.  she is not  needed till later although
moves.9... g6: fianchetto the bishop this is due
moves.10. Qe2: some might say why not Qd2 take out the black bishop.  not bad plan.  but  i had something else in mind.
moves.11... axb5 12. Qxb5+ Qd7 13. Qxd7+ Nbxd7: my intention was to open up that side of the board and rid it of its main defender.  there is more comfort in open field combat.
moves.14... O-O:
both kings have been casled to safety.  black seems to be more secure though.  
    I must say that white has a younger king who sometimes likes to get into the mix.
moves.15. Nb5: threatening d6 hoping to even up material
moves.16. Bxc5: some might say not a great trade giving up a bishop for a knight in game leading to open
moves.16... dxc5 17. Nd6 Rfb8 18. a3: this was preparation for the white square bishop to report to active duty
moves.18... Bf8:
looks like black is activating his black square bishop this is troubling move.
threatens knight and a3 also defending his c5 pawn. busy bishop
moves.19. e5: if he takes kight with bishop white has passed pawn this is good.  also threatening to take knight pushing him into the background
moves.19... Ne8 20. Nxb7: that bishop had to go so white can begin kingside pawn attack
moves.20... Rxb7 21. Bc4: i want that pawn to stay there hendering the black bishop.
moves.21... Rab8 22. b3 Ng7 23. g4 Ra7 24. a4: it is time for the ground troops to open up some wholes in blacks defence for the big guns to enter
moves.24... Ne8: not sure where to put that knight?
moves.25. Kb2: ok this was a hasty desition on my part
moves.26. Kc3: i could have brougth my king up here the other way and saved my pawn
moves.26... Rab4:
i won't loose in trade off here.  my king is really rather safe here.
blacks attack is stunted and his reinforcements have a long journey.
not to mention an attack to defend on the otherside of the board
moves.27. h4 Nc7 28. Rd7: did't really think this knight would stick around to fight a rook standing next to him.  this is a good row for my rook to occupy,
moves.29. Kb2 Nd4 30. f4: i need this pawn and need it right where it moved to.  his second attack didn't cost me any moves only forced the ones i intended to make.
moves.30... h6 31. h5: not taking the pawn could pove more dangerous
moves.31... gxh5 32. gxh5: the g file will be mine
moves.34... Rb8b7: that was not the best move to make very costly.
